SENT.plain: A patient with a documented diagnosis of polyarteritis nodosa and laboratory evidence of a circulating lupus anticoagulant is described
Additional clinical features suggestive of the antiphospholipid antibody syndrome were found
The patient underwent amputation of the first two digits of the foot due to ischemic necrosis
Steroid and immunosuppressive treatment resulted in clinical improvement and disappearance of the circulating anticoagulant, without necessitating additional treatment with oral anticoagulants
The presence of the lupus anticoagulant might have worsened the vascular damage done by polyarteritis nodosa in this patient
